summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Correctional Center, commanding the production of all inmate calls for a specified individual from July 1, 2019, to the present. The subpoena is related to an investigation into alleged violations of federal conspiracy, false statements, and obstruction statutes.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The subpoena commands the Metropolitan Correctional Center to appear before the grand jury or produce specified records by this date.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, New York
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued on August 21, 2019, demanding inmate call records from the Metropolitan Correctional Center for a specific individual from July 1, 2019, onward.
The subpoena is related to an investigation into alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 (conspiracy), 1001 (false statements), 1519 (destruction/alteration of records), and 2 (aiding and abetting).
The records were to be produced by September 11, 2019, to an Assistant United States Attorney, with the option to avoid a personal appearance if records were provided in advance.
The subpoena was issued by Geoffrey S. Berman, then the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.
The document indicates an active federal investigation involving inmate communications at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in mid-2019.
